nightone.phoneguy.lineone: Hello? Hello, hello? Uh, I wanted to record a message for you to help you get settled in on your first night.
nightone.phoneguy.linetwo: Um, I actually worked in that office before you. I'm finishing up my last week now, as a matter of fact. So,
nightone.phoneguy.linethree: I know it can be a bit overwhelming, but I'm here to tell you there's nothing to worry about.
nightone.phoneguy.linefour: Uh, you'll do fine. So, let's just focus on getting you through your first week, okay?
nightone.phoneguy.linefive: Uh, let's see, first there's an introductory greeting from the company that I'm supposed to read.
nightone.phoneguy.linesix: Uh, it's kind of a legal thing, you know. Um, "Welcome to Freddy Fazbear's Pizza.
nightone.phoneguy.lineseven: A magical place for kids and grown-ups alike, where fantasy and fun come to life.
nightone.phoneguy.lineheight: Fazbear Entertainment is not responsible for damage to property or person.
nightone.phoneguy.linenine: Upon discovering that damage or death has occurred, a missing person report will be filed within 90 days, or as soon
nightone.phoneguy.lineten: property and premises have been thoroughly cleaned and bleached, and the carpets have been replaced."
nightone.phoneguy.lineeleven: Blah, blah, blah. Now that might sound bad, I know, but there's really nothing to worry about.
nightone.phoneguy.linetwelve: Uh, the animatronic characters here do get a bit quirky at night, but do I blame them? No.
nightone.phoneguy.linethirteen: If I were forced to sing those same stupid songs for twenty years and I never got a bath?
nightone.phoneguy.linefourteen: I'd probably be a bit irritable at night too. So, remember, these characters hold a
nightone.phoneguy.linefifteen: special place in the hearts of children and we need to show them a little respect, right? Okay.
nightone.phoneguy.linesixteen: So, just be aware, the characters do tend to wander a bit. Uh, they're left in some kind of
nightone.phoneguy.lineseventeen: free roaming mode at night. Uh... something about their servos locking up
nightone.phoneguy.lineeighteen: if they get turned off for too long. Uh, they used to be allowed to walk around during the day too.
nightone.phoneguy.linenineteen: But then there was The Bite of '87. Yeah. I-It's amazing that the human body can live without the frontal lobe, you know?
nightone.phoneguy.linetwenty: Uh, now concerning your safety, the only real risk to you as a night watchman here, if any,
nightone.phoneguy.linetwentyone: is the fact that these characters, uh, if they happen to see you after hours probably won't recognize you as a person.
nightone.phoneguy.linetwentytwo: They'll pr- they'll most likely see you as a metal endoskeleton without its costume on.
nightone.phoneguy.linetwentythree: Now since that's against the rules here at Freddy Fazbear's Pizza, they'll probably try to...
nightone.phoneguy.linetwentyfour: forcefully stuff you inside a Freddy Fazbear suit. Um, now, that wouldn't be so bad
nightone.phoneguy.linetwentyfive: if the suits themselves weren't filled with crossbeams, wires, and animatronic devices,
nightone.phoneguy.linetwentysix: especially around the facial area. So, you could imagine how having your head
nightone.phoneguy.linetwentyseven: forcefully pressed inside one of those could cause a bit of discomfort... and death.
nightone.phoneguy.linetwentyheight: Uh, the only parts of you that would likely see the light of day again would be your eyeballs
nightone.phoneguy.linetwentynine: and teeth when they pop out the front of the mask, heh.
nightone.phoneguy.linethirty: Y-Yeah, they don't tell you these things when you sign up. But hey, first day should be a breeze.
nightone.phoneguy.linethirtyone: I'll chat with you tomorrow. Uh, check those cameras, and remember to close the doors
nightone.phoneguy.linethirtytwo: only if absolutely necessary. Gotta conserve power. Alright, good night.
nighttwo.phoneguy.lineone: Uhh, Hello? Hello? Uh, well, if you're hearing this and you made it to day two, uh, congrats!
nighttwo.phoneguy.linetwo: I-I won't talk quite as long this time since Freddy and his friends tend to become more active as the week progresses.
nighttwo.phoneguy.linethree: Uhh, it might be a good idea to peek at those cameras while I talk
nighttwo.phoneguy.linefour: just to make sure everyone's in their proper place. You know...
nighttwo.phoneguy.linefive: Uh... interestingly enough, Freddy himself doesn't come off stage very often.
nighttwo.phoneguy.linesix: I heard he becomes a lot more active in the dark though, so, hey,
nighttwo.phoneguy.lineseven: I guess that's one more reason not to run out of power, right?
nighttwo.phoneguy.lineheight: I-I also want to emphasize the importance of using your door lights.
nighttwo.phoneguy.linenine: There are blind spots in your camera views, and those blind spots happen to be right outside of your doors.
nighttwo.phoneguy.lineten: So if-if you can't find something, or someone, on your cameras, be sure to check the door lights.
nighttwo.phoneguy.lineeleven: Uh, you might only have a few seconds to react... Uh, not that you would be in any danger, of course.
nighttwo.phoneguy.linetwelve: I'm not implying that. Also, check on the curtain in Pirate Cove from time to time.
nighttwo.phoneguy.linethirteen: The character in there seems unique in that he becomes more active if the cameras remain off for long periods of time.
nighttwo.phoneguy.linefourteen: I guess he doesn't like being watched. I don't know.
nighttwo.phoneguy.linefifteen: Anyway, I'm sure you have everything under control! Uh, talk to you soon.
nighthree.phoneguy.lineone: Hello, hello? Hey you're doing great! Most people don't last this long.
nighthree.phoneguy.linetwo: I mean, you know, they usually move on to other things by now. I'm not implying that they died.
nighthree.phoneguy.linethree: Th-th-that's not what I meant. Uh, anyway I better not take up too much of your time.
nighthree.phoneguy.linefour: Things start getting real tonight. Uh... hey, listen, I had an idea: if you happen to get caught
nighthree.phoneguy.linefive: and want to avoid getting stuffed into a Freddy suit, uhh, try playing dead! You know, go limp.
nighthree.phoneguy.linesix: Then there's a chance that, uh, maybe they'll think that you're an empty costume instead.
nighthree.phoneguy.lineseven: Then again, if they think you're an empty costume, they might try to... stuff a metal skeleton into you.
nighthree.phoneguy.lineheight: I wonder how that would work. Yeah, never mind, scratch that. It's best just not to get caught.
nighthree.phoneguy.linenine: Um... okay, I'll leave you to it. See you on the flip side!
nightfour.phoneguy.lineone: Hello, hello? Hey! Hey, wow, day 4. I knew you could do it. Uh, hey, listen,
nightfour.phoneguy.linetwo: I may not be around to send you a message tomorrow. *banging* It's-It's been a bad night here for me.
nightfour.phoneguy.linethree: Um, I-I'm kinda glad that I recorded my messages for you *clears throat* uh, when I did.
nightfour.phoneguy.linefour: Uh, hey, do me a favor. *banging* Maybe sometime, uh, you could check inside those suits in the back room?
nightfour.phoneguy.linefive: *banging* I'm gonna to try to hold out until someone checks. Maybe it won't be so bad.
nightfour.phoneguy.linesix: *bang bang* Uh, I-I-I-I always wondered what was in all those empty heads back there. *chime plays*.
nightfour.phoneguy.lineseven: You know... *deep moan* oh, no - *noises followed by a loud screech and static*
nightfive.phoneguy.lineone: seldom knows contemporaneous (Omitted: reward; it is enough to possess) the joy of creative (Omitted: service.)
nightfive.phoneguy.linetwo: Countless uses (Omitted: of Bose instruments) will be made by future gener- (Omitted: ations. The scientist)
nightfive.phoneguy.linethree: to indicate the influence of various types of fertilizers on plant growth? You are right.
nightfive.phoneguy.linefour: Would it not be easily possible to employ some of them in quick laboratory experiments
nightfive.phoneguy.linefive: (Omitted: Sir,) it is lamentable that mass agricultural development is (Omitted: not) speeded by fuller use of your marvelous mechanisms.
